alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Portage; Shawano; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 10:42PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Showers and thunderstorms were producing locally heavy rain this evening... At 1041 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms from Black Creek to near Waupaca, then west to near Stevens Point and Wisconsin Rapids. The showers and storms were moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. Torrential rainfall is possible which may lead to localized flooding and ponding of water on area roadways. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Bay around 1110 PM CDT. Bellevue Town around 1115 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by the showers and storms include Appleton, Waupaca, Wautoma, Wayside, Freedom, Allenville, Frazer Corners, Metz, Buckbee, Uw Fox Valley, Dyckesville, Rosholt and Lohrville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
